thread.title: Disney's Night of Joy: Singer Josh Wilson faced fears and now thrives
thread.title_full: Disney's Night of Joy: Singer Josh Wilson faced fears and now thrives

author: Dewayne Bevil
title: Disney's Night of Joy: Singer Josh Wilson faced fears and now thrives
text:
Orlando Sentinel dbevilâ€‹@tribune.com themeparks In 1991, tickets to Halloween Horror Nights were $12.95. No Bill, no Ted, no Rat Lady. More historical HHN facts in a story next week. Josh Wilson plays 'Let it Go' 
Josh Wilson plays 'Let It Go' during a 2014 concert in Michigan, where it was cold. 
Josh Wilson plays 'Let It Go' during a 2014 concert in Michigan, where it was cold. Josh Wilson set for Night of Joy at Magic Kingdom 
Performing on stage in front of thousands of people was not in the initial game plan for singer Josh Wilson. As a kid, he avoided the spotlight, he says. 
"In college, I started writing these songs because I just fell in love with songwriting," he says from his home in Nashville. "I realized that if I didn't sing them and record them then no one would really hear them." Caption Pictures: Upcoming Florida theme-park concerts See more galleries Caption Aug. 27 - John Waite 
British rocker John Waite will be the musical guest Aug. 27 at Velvet Sessions, the lobby concert/cocktail party at Universal's Hard Rock Hotel. 
British rocker John Waite will be the musical guest Aug. 27 at Velvet Sessions, the lobby concert/cocktail party at Universal's Hard Rock Hotel. See more galleries 
He will be heard as part of Night of Joy, a two-day Christian-music festival at Magic Kingdom. This weekend is packed with concert opportunities within the genre as Universal Studios also presents its Christian-music festival, Rock the Universe, on Friday and Saturday. 
Between the two theme parks, more than 30 acts will be available to fans. Wilson performs Friday at Walt Disney World. 
His early gigs were for church youth groups or in coffeehouses, playing for maybe 10 people, Wilson says.
